fullDescription.text:
A possible integer overflow exists in the function `fallback`.
The addition or multiplication may result in a value higher than the maximum representable integer.

This contract executes a message call to an address provided as a function argument. Generally, it is not recommended to call user-supplied addresses using Solidity's call() construct. Note that attackers might leverage reentrancy attacks to exploit race conditions or manipulate this contract's state.
The return value of an external call is not checked. Note that execution continue even if the called contract throws.

Contract locking ether found in /data/demo_analysis/source_code/0x39cfd754c85023648bf003bea2dd498c5612abfa.sol:
	Contract TokenBank has payable functions:
	 - fallback (/data/demo_analysis/source_code/0x39cfd754c85023648bf003bea2dd498c5612abfa.sol#67-70)
	 - Deposit (/data/demo_analysis/source_code/0x39cfd754c85023648bf003bea2dd498c5612abfa.sol#70-76)
	 - WithdrawToHolder (/data/demo_analysis/source_code/0x39cfd754c85023648bf003bea2dd498c5612abfa.sol#90-104)
	But does not have a function to withdraw the ether

76.fullDescription:
A possible integer overflow exists in the function `fallback`.
The addition or multiplication may result in a value higher than the maximum representable integer.
76.name: ArithmeticVulnerability

44.fullDescription: This contract executes a message call to an address provided as a function argument. Generally, it is not recommended to call user-supplied addresses using Solidity's call() construct. Note that attackers might leverage reentrancy attacks to exploit race conditions or manipulate this contract's state.
44.name: ReentrancyVulnerability

44.name: UncheckedLowCallsVulnerability
